data.title: Movies And TV Shows Directed By Robert Altman
data.meta_description: List of all movies and shows directed by Robert Altman, listed alphabetically. This collection includes some of the best movies and shows directed by Robert ...
data.text:
Voting Rules

Vote up your favorite movies and shows directed by Robert Altman!

List of all movies and shows directed by Robert Altman, listed alphabetically. This collection includes some of the best movies and shows directed by Robert Altman, so use the list to find some films and shows you haven't already seen. From Robert Altman's studio films to Robert Altman's independent films, this Robert Altman filmography includes movies and shows from all genres.

Movies here include everything from Dr. T & the Women to 3 Women.

Almost all Robert Altman director credits are included. If you’re wondering, “What movies and shows did Robert Altman direct?” or “What is the best Robert Altman movie or show?” then this list will answer your questions.

Who did Robert Altman work with as a director? Talent includes the likes of Robert Downey Jr., Meryl Streep, and Bruce Willis. Do you love films or shows directed by Robert Altman? Check out our lists of the best movies by John Huston and David Lean as well.

Ranked by

Film (1977)

Actors : Sissy Spacek, Shelley Duvall, Janice Rule, Robert Fortier, Ruth Nelson

Released : 1977

Directed by : Robert Altman

Writer/director Robert Altman claimed this impressionistic film came to him in a dream. Millie Lammoreaux (Shelley Duvall) considers herself irresistible to men, though in fact men have little trouble resisting her. Mysterious teenager Pinky Rose (Sissy Spacek), Millie's fellow physical therapist at a desert spa who becomes her roommate at a singles-only apartment building, at first appears worshipful of Millie's self-confidence but soon seems to be taking over aspects of her personality.

Film (1979)

Actors : Paul Dooley, Marta Heflin, Titos Vandis

Released : 1979

Directed by : Robert Altman

Having thus far failed at love, middle-aged Alex Theodopoulos (Paul Dooley) begins a romance with a spirited young bohemian named Sheila Shea (Marta Heflin), a musician with rock band looking to break into the big time. Since Alex is looking to reinvent his life, he decides to join Sheila and the band on tour, where he tries to become acclimated to their freewheeling lifestyle -- with decidedly mixed results. Will this blossoming romance survive the road?

Film (2006)

Actors : Meryl Streep, Lindsay Lohan, Kevin Kline, Woody Harrelson, Garrison Keillor

Released : 2006

Directed by : Robert Altman

A private investigator (Kevin Kline) keeps tabs on the proceedings as guests, cast and crew (Meryl Streep, Lindsay Lohan, Woody Harrelson) of a long-running radio show prepare for the final broadcast. Their home, the Fitzgerald Theater, is due for demolition, and they await the arrival of the Texas axe-man (Tommy Lee Jones). Meanwhile, the show's creator and host (Garrison Keillor) conducts business as usual in the face of the show's impending demise.

Film (1978)

Actors : Carol Burnett, Desi Arnaz, Amy Stryker, Vittorio Gassman, Geraldine Chaplin

Released : 1978

Directed by : Robert Altman

Friends and family of the bride (Amy Stryker) and groom (Desi Arnaz Jr.) carry on at a mansion before, during and after the ceremony.

Film (1987)

Actors : John Hurt, Theresa Russell, Buck Henry, Roy Hyatt, Sevilla Delofski

Released : 1987

Directed by : Robert Altman, Bruce Beresford, Bill Bryden, Jean-Luc Godard, Derek Jarman

In this opera-based anthology, 10 directors interpret 10 popular arias. Among others, Robert Altman imagines the opening night of Jean-Philippe Rameau's "Les Boréades" in 1734 Paris; Jean-Luc Godard envisions Jean-Bapiste Lully's "Armide" as the story of French maids desperately trying to seduce burly bodybuilders lifting weights at the gym; and Julien Temple stages Giuseppe Verdi's "Rigoletto" with synchronous infidelities occurring at the same hotel.

Better Football

Film

Released : 1954

Directed by : Robert Altman
